description.narrative: Emergia Contact Center S.L. (Emergia) is a well established Business Process Outsourcing and Contact Center outsourcing company. The company started its operations in 2005 in Spain and, to date, has over 4,600 employees in 3 countries, as follows: Spain (2,000 employees), Colombia (1,500 employees) and Chile (1,100 employees). The Company is in the process of ramping up its operations in Latin America over the next 3 years by expanding its capacity in Colombia by 50% during 2011 and launching two new contact centers in Peru and Nicaragua in the period 2011-2013. Emergia has requested from IFC long term funding to help it finance this expansion.

Positive social effects of Emergia are largely tied to increased employment opportunities, particularly in smaller university towns and for women, who represent 67% of Emergia's workforce. Employees at Emergia benefit from childcare facilities, 24-hour on site medic and other services largely unavailable locally.
Emergia is typically an "anchor employer" in the smaller towns where it operates, employing hundreds of people and providing to many their first job. Some of these towns suffer from chronically high unemployment rates. A rise in employment and an ascending middle class has positive spillover effect in the local economic community. It is estimated that 4 indirect jobs are created from each direct job in the contact center industry.
